metadata.title: CVE-2023-25732 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: When encoding data from an inputStream in xpcomthe size of the input being encoded was not correctly calculatedpotentially leading to an out of bounds memory write. This vulnerabilityaffects Firefox < 110, Thunderbird < 102.8, and Firefox ESR < 102.8. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-25732` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: firefox - 110.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 firefox-geckodriver - 110.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 firefox-mozsymbols - 110.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 No subscription required thunderbird - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '110.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs52 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
